text: Frances Jane Crosby (usually known as Fanny Crosby) (March 24, 1820 â€“ February 12, 1915) was an American poet and lyricist. She wrote Protestant hymns. She was a lifelong Methodist. She wrote over 8,000 hymns in her life, even though she became blind shortly after she was born. She was also known for her preaching and speaking. Crosby is one of the most famous hymn writers in history.
